name: array
headline: Package array provides functions for manipulating array and building tables from arrays.

concat.name: concat
concat.headline: concat appends two arrays and returns a new array.

parameters.name: arr
parameters.headline: arr: First array. Default is the piped-forward array (`<-`).

parameters.name: v
parameters.headline: v: Array to append to the first array.

source_location.source: builtin concat : (<-arr: [A], v: [A]) => [A]

filter.name: filter
filter.headline:
filter iterates over an array, evaluates each element with a predicate function, and then returns
a new array with only elements that match the predicate.

parameters.name: arr
parameters.headline: arr: Array to filter. Default is the piped-forward array (`<-`).

parameters.name: fn
parameters.headline:
fn: Predicate function to evaluate on each element.
  The element is represented by `x` in the predicate function.

source_location.source: builtin filter : (<-arr: [A], fn: (x: A) => bool) => [A]

from.name: from
from.headline: from constructs a table from an array of records.

parameters.name: rows
parameters.headline: rows: Array of records to construct a table with. Default is the piped-forward array (`<-`).

source_location.source: builtin from : (<-rows: [A]) => stream[A] where A: Record

map.name: map
map.headline:
map iterates over an array, applies a function to each element to produce a new element,
and then returns a new array.

parameters.name: arr
parameters.headline: arr: Array to operate on. Defaults is the piped-forward array (`<-`).

parameters.name: fn
parameters.headline: fn: Function to apply to elements. The element is represented by `x` in the function.

source_location.source: builtin map : (<-arr: [A], fn: (x: A) => B) => [B]

name: naiveBayesClassifier
headline:
Package naiveBayesClassifier provides an implementation of
a naive Bayes classifier.

naiveBayes.name: naiveBayes
naiveBayes.headline: naiveBayes performs a naive Bayes classification.

parameters.name: myMeasurement
parameters.headline: myMeasurement: Measurement to use as training data.

parameters.name: myField
parameters.headline: myField: Field to use as training data.

parameters.name: myClass
parameters.headline: myClass: Class to classify against.

parameters.name: tables
parameters.headline: tables: Input data. Default is piped-forward data (`<-`).

naiveBayes.flux_type:
(
    <-tables: stream[{C with _time: time, _measurement: E, _field: D}],
    myClass: string,
    myField: A,
    myMeasurement: B,
) => stream[F] where A: Equatable, B: Equatable, D: Equatable, E: Equatable, F: Record

source_location.source:
naiveBayes = (tables=<-, myClass, myField, myMeasurement) => {
    training_data =
        tables
            //data for 3 days
            |> range(start: 2020-01-02T00:00:00Z, stop: 2020-01-06T23:00:00Z)
            |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == myMeasurement and r["_field"] == myField)
            |> group()

    //|> yield(name: "trainingData")
    test_data =
        tables
            //data for 1 day
            |> range(start: 2020-01-01T00:00:00Z, stop: 2020-01-01T23:00:00Z)
            |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == myMeasurement and r["_field"] == myField)
            |> group()

    //|> yield(name: "test data")
    //data preparation
    r =
        training_data
            |> group(columns: ["_field"])
            |> count()
            |> tableFind(fn: (key) => key._field == myField)
    r2 = getRecord(table: r, idx: 0)
    total_count = r2._value
    P_Class_k =
        training_data
            |> group(columns: [myClass, "_field"])
            |> count()
            |> map(
                fn: (r) =>
                    ({r with p_k: float(v: r._value) / float(v: total_count), tc: total_count}),
            )
            |> group()

    //one table for each class, where r.p_k == P(Class_k)
    P_value_x =
        training_data
            |> group(columns: ["_value", "_field"])
            |> count(column: myClass)
            |> map(
                fn: (r) =>
                    ({r with p_x: float(v: r.airborne) / float(v: total_count), tc: total_count}),
            )

    // one table for each value, where r.p_x == P(value_x)
    P_k_x =
        training_data
            |> group(columns: ["_field", "_value", myClass])
            |> reduce(fn: (r, accumulator) => ({sum: 1.0 + accumulator.sum}), identity: {sum: 0.0})
            |> group()

    // one table for each value and Class pair, where r.p_k_x == P(value_x | Class_k)
    P_k_x_class =
        join(tables: {P_k_x: P_k_x, P_Class_k: P_Class_k}, on: [myClass], method: "inner")
            |> group(columns: [myClass, "_value_P_k_x"])
            |> limit(n: 1)
            |> map(fn: (r) => ({r with P_x_k: r.sum / float(v: r._value_P_Class_k)}))
            |> drop(columns: ["_field_P_Class_k", "_value_P_Class_k"])
            |> rename(columns: {_field_P_k_x: "_field", _value_P_k_x: "_value"})
    P_k_x_class_Drop =
        join(tables: {P_k_x: P_k_x, P_Class_k: P_Class_k}, on: [myClass], method: "inner")
            |> drop(columns: ["_field_P_Class_k", "_value_P_Class_k", "_field_P_k_x"])
            |> group(columns: [myClass, "_value_P_k_x"])
            |> limit(n: 1)
            |> map(fn: (r) => ({r with P_x_k: r.sum / float(v: r._value_P_Class_k)}))

    //added P(value_x) to table
    //calculated probabilities for training data
    Probability_table =
        join(
            tables: {P_k_x_class: P_k_x_class, P_value_x: P_value_x},
            on: ["_value", "_field"],
            method: "inner",
        )
            |> map(fn: (r) => ({r with Probability: r.P_x_k * r.p_k / r.p_x}))

    //|> yield(name: "final")
    //predictions for test data computed
    predictOverall = (tables=<-) => {
        r =
            tables
                |> keep(columns: ["_value", "Animal_name", "_field"])
        output =
            join(
                tables: {Probability_table: Probability_table, r: r},
                on: ["_value"],
                method: "inner",
            )

        return output
    }

    return test_data |> predictOverall()
}

name: anomalydetection
headline: Package anomalydetection detects anomalies in time series data.

mad.name: mad
mad.headline: mad uses the median absolute deviation (MAD) algorithm to detect anomalies in a data set.

parameters.name: threshold
parameters.headline: threshold: Deviation threshold for anomalies.

parameters.name: table
parameters.headline: table: Input data. Default is piped-forward data (`<-`).

mad.flux_type: (<-table: stream[B], ?threshold: A) => stream[{C with level: string, _value_diff_med: D, _value_diff: D, _value: D}] where A: Comparable + Equatable, B: Record, D: Comparable + Divisible + Equatable

source_location.source:
mad = (table=<-, threshold=3.0) => {
    // MEDiXi = med(x)
    data = table |> group(columns: ["_time"], mode: "by")
    med = data |> median(column: "_value")

    // diff = |Xi - MEDiXi| = math.abs(xi-med(xi))
    diff =
        join(tables: {data: data, med: med}, on: ["_time"], method: "inner")
            |> map(fn: (r) => ({r with _value: math.abs(x: r._value_data - r._value_med)}))
            |> drop(columns: ["_start", "_stop", "_value_med", "_value_data"])

    // The constant k is needed to make the estimator consistent for the parameter of interest.
    // In the case of the usual parameter at Gaussian distributions k = 1.4826
    k = 1.4826

    // MAD =  k * MEDi * |Xi - MEDiXi|
    diff_med =
        diff
            |> median(column: "_value")
            |> map(fn: (r) => ({r with MAD: k * r._value}))
            |> filter(fn: (r) => r.MAD > 0.0)
    output =
        join(tables: {diff: diff, diff_med: diff_med}, on: ["_time"], method: "inner")
            |> map(fn: (r) => ({r with _value: r._value_diff / r._value_diff_med}))
            |> map(
                fn: (r) =>
                    ({r with level:
                            if r._value >= threshold then
                                "anomaly"
                            else
                                "normal",
                    }),
            )

    return output
}

name: statsmodels
headline: Package statsmodels provides functions for calculating statistical models.

linearRegression.name: linearRegression
linearRegression.headline: linearRegression performs a linear regression.

parameters.name: tables
parameters.headline: tables: Input data. Default is piped-forward data (`<-`).

linearRegression.flux_type:
(
    <-tables: stream[A],
) => stream[{
    B with
    y_hat: float,
    y: float,
    x: float,
    sy: H,
    sxy: G,
    sxx: F,
    sx: E,
    slope: D,
    errors: float,
    N: C,
}] where A: Record, D: Divisible + Subtractable

source_location.source:
linearRegression = (tables=<-) => {
    renameAndSum =
        tables
            |> rename(columns: {_value: "y"})
            |> map(fn: (r) => ({r with x: 1.0}))
            |> cumulativeSum(columns: ["x"])
    t =
        renameAndSum
            |> reduce(
                fn: (r, accumulator) =>
                    ({
                        sx: r.x + accumulator.sx,
                        sy: r.y + accumulator.sy,
                        N: accumulator.N + 1.0,
                        sxy: r.x * r.y + accumulator.sxy,
                        sxx: r.x * r.x + accumulator.sxx,
                    }),
                identity: {
                    sxy: 0.0,
                    sx: 0.0,
                    sy: 0.0,
                    sxx: 0.0,
                    N: 0.0,
                },
            )
            |> tableFind(fn: (key) => true)
            |> getRecord(idx: 0)
    xbar = t.sx / t.N
    ybar = t.sy / t.N
    slope = (t.sxy - xbar * ybar * t.N) / (t.sxx - t.N * xbar * xbar)
    intercept = ybar - slope * xbar
    y_hat = (r) =>
        ({r with
            y_hat: slope * r.x + intercept,
            slope: slope,
            sx: t.sx,
            sxy: t.sxy,
            sxx: t.sxx,
            N: t.N,
            sy: t.sy,
        })
    rse = (r) => ({r with errors: (r.y - r.y_hat) ^ 2.0})
    output =
        renameAndSum
            |> map(fn: y_hat)
            |> map(fn: rse)

    return output
}

name: alerta
headline: Package alerta provides functions that send alerts to [Alerta](https://alerta.io/).

alert.name: alert
alert.headline: alert sends an alert to [Alerta](https://alerta.io/).

parameters.name: url
parameters.headline: url: (Required) Alerta URL.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.headline: apiKey: (Required) Alerta API key.

parameters.name: resource
parameters.headline: resource: (Required) Resource associated with the alert.

parameters.name: event
parameters.headline: event: (Required) Event name.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.headline: environment: Alerta environment. Valid values: "Production", "Development" or empty string (default).

parameters.name: severity
parameters.headline: severity: (Required) Event severity. See [Alerta severities](https://docs.alerta.io/en/latest/api/alert.html#alert-severities).

parameters.name: service
parameters.headline: service: List of affected services. Default is `[]`.

parameters.name: group
parameters.headline: group: Alerta event group. Default is `""`.

parameters.name: value
parameters.headline: value: Event value.  Default is `""`.

parameters.name: text
parameters.headline: text: Alerta text description. Default is `""`.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.headline: tags: List of event tags. Default is `[]`.

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.headline: attributes: (Required) Alert attributes.

parameters.name: origin
parameters.headline: origin: monitoring component.

parameters.name: type
parameters.headline: type: Event type. Default is `""`.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.headline: timestamp: time alert was generated. Default is `now()`.

alert.flux_type:
(
    apiKey: string,
    attributes: A,
    event: B,
    resource: C,
    severity: D,
    url: string,
    ?environment: E,
    ?group: F,
    ?origin: G,
    ?service: H,
    ?tags: I,
    ?text: J,
    ?timestamp: K,
    ?type: L,
    ?value: M,
) => int

source_location.source:
alert = (
        url,
        apiKey,
        resource,
        event,
        environment="",
        severity,
        service=[],
        group="",
        value="",
        text="",
        tags=[],
        attributes,
        origin="InfluxDB",
        type="",
        timestamp=now(),
    ) =>
    {
        alert = {
            resource: resource,
            event: event,
            environment: environment,
            severity: severity,
            service: service,
            group: group,
            value: value,
            text: text,
            tags: tags,
            attributes: attributes,
            origin: origin,
            type: type,
            createTime: strings.substring(v: string(v: timestamp), start: 0, end: 23) + "Z",
                // Alerta supports ISO 8601 date format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ only

        }
        headers = {"Authorization": "Key " + apiKey, "Content-Type": "application/json"}
        body = json.encode(v: alert)

        return http.post(headers: headers, url: url, data: body)
    }

endpoint.name: endpoint
endpoint.headline: endpoint sends alerts to Alerta using data from input rows.

parameters.name: url
parameters.headline: url: (Required) Alerta URL.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.headline: apiKey: (Required) Alerta API key.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.headline:
environment: Alert environment. Default is `""`.
  Valid values: "Production", "Development", or empty string (default).

parameters.name: origin
parameters.headline: origin: Alert origin. Default is `"InfluxDB"`.

endpoint.flux_type:
(
    apiKey: string,
    url: string,
    ?environment: A,
    ?origin: B,
) => (
    mapFn: (
        r: C,
    ) => {
        D with
        value: O,
        type: N,
        timestamp: M,
        text: L,
        tags: K,
        severity: J,
        service: I,
        resource: H,
        group: G,
        event: F,
        attributes: E,
    },
) => (<-tables: stream[C]) => stream[{C with _sent: string}]

source_location.source:
endpoint = (url, apiKey, environment="", origin="") =>
    (mapFn) =>
        (tables=<-) =>
            tables
                |> map(
                    fn: (r) => {
                        obj = mapFn(r: r)

                        return {r with _sent:
                                string(
                                    v:
                                        2 == alert(
                                                url: url,
                                                apiKey: apiKey,
                                                resource: obj.resource,
                                                event: obj.event,
                                                environment: environment,
                                                severity: obj.severity,
                                                service: obj.service,
                                                group: obj.group,
                                                value: obj.value,
                                                text: obj.text,
                                                tags: obj.tags,
                                                attributes: obj.attributes,
                                                origin: origin,
                                                type: obj.type,
                                                timestamp: obj.timestamp,
                                            ) / 100,
                                ),
                        }
                    },
                )

name: servicenow
headline: Package servicenow  provides functions for sending events to [ServiceNow](https://www.servicenow.com/).

endpoint.name: endpoint
endpoint.headline: endpoint sends events to [ServiceNow](https://servicenow.com/) using data from input rows.

parameters.name: url
parameters.headline: url: ServiceNow web service URL.

parameters.name: username
parameters.headline: username: ServiceNow username to use for HTTP BASIC authentication.

parameters.name: password
parameters.headline: password: ServiceNow password to use for HTTP BASIC authentication.

parameters.name: source
parameters.headline: source: Source name. Default is `"Flux"`.

endpoint.flux_type:
(
    password: string,
    url: string,
    username: string,
    ?source: A,
) => (
    mapFn: (
        r: B,
    ) => {
        C with
        severity: J,
        resource: I,
        node: H,
        metricType: G,
        metricName: F,
        messageKey: E,
        description: D,
    },
) => (<-tables: stream[B]) => stream[{B with _sent: string}] where J: Equatable

source_location.source:
endpoint = (url, username, password, source="Flux") =>
    (mapFn) =>
        (tables=<-) =>
            tables
                |> map(
                    fn: (r) => {
                        obj = mapFn(r: r)

                        return {r with _sent:
                                string(
                                    v:
                                        2 == event(
                                                url: url,
                                                username: username,
                                                password: password,
                                                source: source,
                                                node: obj.node,
                                                metricType: obj.metricType,
                                                resource: obj.resource,
                                                metricName: obj.metricName,
                                                messageKey: obj.messageKey,
                                                description: obj.description,
                                                severity: obj.severity,
                                                additionalInfo:
                                                    record.get(
                                                        r: obj,
                                                        key: "additionalInfo",
                                                        default: record.any,
                                                    ),
                                            ) / 100,
                                ),
                        }
                    },
                )

event.name: event
event.headline: event sends an event to [ServiceNow](https://servicenow.com/).

parameters.name: url
parameters.headline: url: ServiceNow web service URL.

parameters.name: username
parameters.headline: username: ServiceNow username to use for HTTP BASIC authentication.

parameters.name: password
parameters.headline: password: ServiceNow password to use for HTTP BASIC authentication.

parameters.name: description
parameters.headline: description: Event description.

parameters.name: severity
parameters.headline: severity: Severity of the event.

parameters.name: source
parameters.headline: source: Source name. Default is `"Flux"`.

parameters.name: node
parameters.headline:
node: Node name or IP address related to the event.
  Default is an empty string (`""`).

parameters.name: metricType
parameters.headline:
metricType: Metric type related to the event (for example, `CPU`).
  Default is an empty string (`""`).

parameters.name: resource
parameters.headline:
resource: Resource related to the event (for example, `CPU-1`).
  Default is an empty string (`""`).

parameters.name: metricName
parameters.headline:
metricName: Metric name related to the event (for example, `usage_idle`).
  Default is an empty string (`""`).

parameters.name: messageKey
parameters.headline:
messageKey: Unique identifier of the event (for example, the InfluxDB alert ID).
  Default is an empty string (`""`).
  If an empty string, ServiceNow generates a value.

parameters.name: additionalInfo
parameters.headline: additionalInfo: Additional information to include with the event.

event.flux_type:
(
    description: A,
    password: string,
    severity: B,
    url: string,
    username: string,
    ?additionalInfo: C,
    ?messageKey: D,
    ?metricName: E,
    ?metricType: F,
    ?node: G,
    ?resource: H,
    ?source: I,
) => int where B: Equatable, C: Equatable

source_location.source:
event = (
        url,
        username,
        password,
        source="Flux",
        node="",
        metricType="",
        resource="",
        metricName="",
        messageKey="",
        description,
        severity,
        additionalInfo=record.any,
    ) =>
    {
        event = {
            source: source,
            node: node,
            type: metricType,
            resource: resource,
            metric_name: metricName,
            message_key: messageKey,
            description: description,
            severity:
                if severity == "critical" then
                    "1"
                else if severity == "major" then
                    "2"
                else if severity == "minor" then
                    "3"
                else if severity == "warning" then
                    "4"
                else if severity == "info" then
                    "5"
                else if severity == "clear" then
                    "0"
                else
                    "",
            // shouldn't happen
            additional_info:
                if additionalInfo == record.any then
                    ""
                else
                    string(v: json.encode(v: additionalInfo)),
        }
        payload = {records: [event]}
        headers = {
            "Authorization": http.basicAuth(u: username, p: password),
            "Content-Type": "application/json",
        }
        body = json.encode(v: payload)

        return http.post(headers: headers, url: url, data: body)
    }

name: tickscript
headline:
Package tickscript provides functions to help migrate
Kapacitor [TICKscripts](https://docs.influxdata.com/kapacitor/latest/tick/) to Flux tasks.

alert.name: alert
alert.headline:
alert identifies events of varying severity levels
and writes them to the `statuses` measurement in the InfluxDB `_monitoring`
system bucket.

parameters.name: check
parameters.headline:
check: InfluxDB check data.
  See `tickscript.defineCheck()`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.headline:
id: Function that returns the InfluxDB check ID provided by the check record.
  Default is `(r) => "${r._check_id}"`.

parameters.name: details
parameters.headline:
details: Function to return the InfluxDB check details using data from input rows.
  Default is `(r) => ""`.

parameters.name: message
parameters.headline:
message: Function to return the InfluxDB check message using data from input rows.
  Default is `(r) => "Threshold Check: ${r._check_name} is: ${r._level}"`.

parameters.name: crit
parameters.headline: crit: Predicate function to determine `crit` status. Default is `(r) => false`.

parameters.name: warn
parameters.headline: warn: Predicate function to determine `warn` status. Default is `(r) => false`.

parameters.name: info
parameters.headline: info: Predicate function to determine `info` status. Default is `(r) => false`.

parameters.name: ok
parameters.headline: ok: Predicate function to determine `ok` status. Default is `(r) => true`.

parameters.name: topic
parameters.headline: topic: Check topic. Default is `""`.

parameters.name: tables
parameters.headline: tables: Input data. Default is piped-forward data (`<-`).

alert.flux_type:
(
    <-tables: stream[M],
    check: {A with tags: E, _type: D, _check_name: C, _check_id: B},
    ?crit: (r: {F with _time: H, _measurement: G}) => bool,
    ?details: (r: {I with id: J, _check_name: C, _check_id: B}) => K,
    ?id: (r: {I with _check_name: C, _check_id: B}) => J,
    ?info: (r: {F with _time: H, _measurement: G}) => bool,
    ?message: (
        r: {
            F with
            _type: D,
            _time: H,
            _time: time,
            _source_timestamp: int,
            _source_measurement: G,
            _measurement: G,
            _measurement: string,
            _level: string,
            _check_name: C,
            _check_id: B,
        },
    ) => L,
    ?ok: (r: {F with _time: H, _measurement: G}) => bool,
    ?topic: string,
    ?warn: (r: {F with _time: H, _measurement: G}) => bool,
) => stream[{
    F with
    _type: D,
    _time: H,
    _time: time,
    _source_timestamp: int,
    _source_measurement: G,
    _message: L,
    _measurement: G,
    _measurement: string,
    _level: string,
    _check_name: C,
    _check_id: B,
}] where E: Record, I: Record, M: Record

source_location.source:
alert = (
        check,
        id=(r) => "${r._check_id}",
        details=(r) => "",
        message=(r) => "Threshold Check: ${r._check_name} is: ${r._level}",
        crit=(r) => false,
        warn=(r) => false,
        info=(r) => false,
        ok=(r) => true,
        topic="",
        tables=<-,
    ) =>
    {
        _addTopic =
            if topic != "" then
                (tables=<-) =>
                    tables
                        |> set(key: "_topic", value: topic)
                        |> experimental.group(mode: "extend", columns: ["_topic"])
            else
                (tables=<-) => tables

        return
            tables
                |> drop(fn: (column) => column =~ /_start.*/ or column =~ /_stop.*/)
                |> map(
                    fn: (r) =>
                        ({r with _check_id: check._check_id, _check_name: check._check_name}),
                )
                |> map(fn: (r) => ({r with id: id(r: r)}))
                |> map(fn: (r) => ({r with details: details(r: r)}))
                |> _addTopic()
                |> monitor.check(
                    crit: crit,
                    warn: warn,
                    info: info,
                    ok: ok,
                    messageFn: message,
                    data: check,
                )
    }

compute.name: compute
compute.headline:
compute is an alias for `tickscript.select()` that changes a columnâ€™s name and
optionally applies an aggregate or selector function.

parameters.name: as
parameters.headline: as: New column name.

parameters.name: column
parameters.headline: column: Column to operate on. Default is `_value`.

parameters.name: fn
parameters.headline: fn: Aggregate or selector function to apply.

parameters.name: tables
parameters.headline: tables: Input data. Default is piped-forward data (`<-`).

compute.flux_type: (<-tables: B, as: string, ?column: A, ?fn: (<-: B, column: A) => stream[C]) => stream[D] where A: Equatable, C: Record, D: Record

source_location.source: compute = select

deadman.name: deadman
deadman.headline:
deadman detects low data throughput and writes a point with a critical status to
the InfluxDB `_monitoring` system bucket.

parameters.name: check
parameters.headline: check: InfluxDB check data. See `tickscript.defineCheck()`.

parameters.name: measurement
parameters.headline: measurement: Measurement name. Should match the queried measurement.

parameters.name: threshold
parameters.headline: threshold: Count threshold. Default is `0`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.headline:
id: Function that returns the InfluxDB check ID provided by the check record.
  Default is `(r) => "${r._check_id}"`.

parameters.name: message
parameters.headline:
message: Function that returns the InfluxDB check message using data from input rows.
  Default is `(r) => "Deadman Check: ${r._check_name} is: " + (if r.dead then "dead" else "alive")`.

parameters.name: topic
parameters.headline: topic: Check topic. Default is `""`.

parameters.name: tables
parameters.headline: tables: Input data. Default is piped-forward data (`<-`).

deadman.flux_type:
(
    <-tables: stream[M],
    check: {A with tags: E, _type: D, _check_name: C, _check_id: B},
    measurement: string,
    ?id: (r: {F with _check_name: C, _check_id: B}) => G,
    ?message: (
        r: {
            H with
            dead: bool,
            _type: D,
            _time: J,
            _time: time,
            _source_timestamp: int,
            _source_measurement: I,
            _measurement: I,
            _measurement: string,
            _level: string,
            _check_name: C,
            _check_id: B,
        },
    ) => K,
    ?threshold: L,
    ?topic: string,
) => stream[{
    H with
    dead: bool,
    _type: D,
    _time: J,
    _time: time,
    _source_timestamp: int,
    _source_measurement: I,
    _message: K,
    _measurement: I,
    _measurement: string,
    _level: string,
    _check_name: C,
    _check_id: B,
}] where E: Record, F: Record, L: Comparable + Equatable, M: Record

source_location.source:
deadman =
    (
            check,
            measurement,
            threshold=0,
            id=(r) => "${r._check_id}",
            message=(r) =>
                "Deadman Check: ${r._check_name} is: " + (if r.dead then "dead" else "alive"),
            topic="",
            tables=<-,
        ) =>
        {
            // In order to detect empty stream (without tables), we concatenate input with dummy stream and count the result,
            // because count() returns nothing for empty stream. If the input stream is empty, then dummy stream with empty
            // table is used as input for actual threshold check in order to get 0.
            _dummy =
                array.from(rows: [{_time: 2000-01-01T00:00:00Z, _field: "unknown", _value: 0}])
                    |> set(key: "_measurement", value: measurement)
                    // required by monitor.check
                    |> experimental.group(columns: ["_measurement"], mode: "extend")
                    // input tables are expected to be pivoted already
                    |> schema.fieldsAsCols()
            _counts =
                union(tables: [_dummy, tables])
                    |> keep(columns: ["_measurement", "_time"])
                    // _measurement column is always present
                    |> duplicate(column: "_measurement", as: "__value__")
                    |> count(column: "__value__")
                    |> findColumn(fn: (key) => key._measurement == measurement, column: "__value__")
            _tables =
                // only dummy table is in the concatenated stream
                if _counts[0] == 1 then
                    _dummy
                        |> drop(columns: ["unknown"])
                        // need empty table
                        |> limit(n: 0)
                else
                    tables

            return
                _tables
                    // _measurement column is always present
                    |> duplicate(column: "_measurement", as: "__value__")
                    |> count(column: "__value__")
                    // recreate _time column after aggregation
                    |> map(fn: (r) => ({r with _time: now()}))
                    // same tag that monitor.deadman() adds
                    |> map(fn: (r) => ({r with dead: r.__value__ <= threshold}))
                    // drop dummy field
                    |> drop(columns: ["__value__"])
                    |> alert(
                        check: check,
                        id: id,
                        message: message,
                        crit: (r) => r.dead,
                        topic: topic,
                    )
        }

defineCheck.name: defineCheck
defineCheck.headline: defineCheck creates custom check data required by `alert()` and `deadman()`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.headline: id: InfluxDB check ID.

parameters.name: name
parameters.headline: name: InfluxDB check name.

parameters.name: type
parameters.headline: type: InfluxDB check type. Default is `custom`.

defineCheck.flux_type: (id: A, name: B, ?type: C) => {tags: {}, _type: C, _check_name: B, _check_id: A}

groupBy.name: groupBy
groupBy.headline: groupBy groups results by the `_measurement` column and other specified columns.

parameters.name: columns
parameters.headline: columns: List of columns to group by.

parameters.name: tables
parameters.headline: tables: Input data. Default is piped-forward data (`<-`).

groupBy.flux_type: (<-tables: stream[A], columns: [string]) => stream[A] where A: Record

source_location.source:
groupBy = (columns, tables=<-) =>
    tables
        |> group(columns: columns)
        // required by monitor.check
        |> experimental.group(columns: ["_measurement"], mode: "extend")

join.name: join
join.headline:
join merges two input streams into a single output stream
based on specified columns with equal values and appends a new measurement name.

parameters.name: tables
parameters.headline: tables: Map of two streams to join.

parameters.name: on
parameters.headline: on: List of columns to join on. Default is `["_time"]`.

parameters.name: measurement
parameters.headline: measurement: Measurement name to use in results.

join.flux_type: (measurement: A, tables: B, ?on: [string]) => stream[{C with _measurement: A}] where B: Record, C: Record

source_location.source:
join = (tables, on=["_time"], measurement) =>
    universe.join(tables: tables, on: on)
        |> map(fn: (r) => ({r with _measurement: measurement}))
        // required by monitor.check
        |> experimental.group(columns: ["_measurement"], mode: "extend")

select.name: select
select.headline:
select changes a columnâ€™s name and optionally applies an aggregate or selector
function to values in the column.

parameters.name: column
parameters.headline: column: Column to operate on. Default is `_value`.

parameters.name: fn
parameters.headline: fn: Aggregate or selector function to apply.

parameters.name: as
parameters.headline: as: New column name.

parameters.name: tables
parameters.headline: tables: Input data. Default is piped-forward data (`<-`).

select.flux_type: (<-tables: B, as: string, ?column: A, ?fn: (<-: B, column: A) => stream[C]) => stream[D] where A: Equatable, C: Record, D: Record

source_location.source:
select = (column="_value", fn=(column, tables=<-) => tables, as, tables=<-) => {
    _column = column
    _as = as

    return
        tables
            |> fn(column: _column)
            |> rename(fn: (column) => if column == _column then _as else column)
}

selectWindow.name: selectWindow
selectWindow.headline:
selectWindow changes a columnâ€™s name, windows rows by time, and then applies an
aggregate or selector function the specified column for each window of time.

parameters.name: column
parameters.headline: column: Column to operate on. Default is _value.

parameters.name: fn
parameters.headline: fn: Aggregate or selector function to apply.

parameters.name: as
parameters.headline: as: New column name.

parameters.name: every
parameters.headline: every: Duration of windows.

parameters.name: defaultValue
parameters.headline:
defaultValue: Default fill value for null values in column.
  Must be the same data type as column.

parameters.name: tables
parameters.headline: tables: Input data. Default is piped-forward data (`<-`).

selectWindow.flux_type:
(
    <-tables: stream[D],
    as: string,
    defaultValue: A,
    every: duration,
    fn: (<-: stream[B], column: string) => stream[C],
    ?column: string,
) => stream[E] where B: Record, C: Record, D: Record, E: Record

source_location.source:
selectWindow = (
        column="_value",
        fn,
        as,
        every,
        defaultValue,
        tables=<-,
    ) =>
    {
        _column = column
        _as = as

        return
            tables
                |> aggregateWindow(every: every, fn: fn, column: _column, createEmpty: true)
                |> fill(column: _column, value: defaultValue)
                |> rename(fn: (column) => if column == _column then _as else column)
    }

alert.flux_type:
(

endpoint.name: endpoint

parameters.name: monitoringTool
parameters.headline:
monitoringTool: Tool to use for monitoring.
  Default is `InfluxDB`.

source_location.source:
endpoint = (url, monitoringTool="InfluxDB") =>
    (mapFn) =>
        (tables=<-) =>
            tables
                |> map(
                    fn: (r) => {
                        obj = mapFn(r: r)

                        return {r with _sent:
                                string(
                                    v:
                                        2 == alert(
                                                url: url,
                                                messageType: obj.messageType,
                                                entityID: obj.entityID,
                                                entityDisplayName: obj.entityDisplayName,
                                                stateMessage: obj.stateMessage,
                                                timestamp: obj.timestamp,
                                                monitoringTool: monitoringTool,
                                            ) / 100,
                                ),
                        }
                    },
                )

parameters.name: username

parameters.name: device

parameters.name: component

  Default is `""`.

parameters.name: severity

parameters.name: eventClass
parameters.headline:

  Default is `""`.

  Default is `""`.

parameters.name: collector

  Default is `""`.

parameters.headline:

  Default is `""`.

event.flux_type:
(
    severity: A,
    url: string,
    ?action: B,
    ?apiKey: C,
    ?collector: D,
    ?component: E,
    ?device: F,
    ?eventClass: G,
    ?eventClassKey: H,
    ?message: I,
    ?method: J,
    ?password: string,
    ?summary: K,
    ?tid: L,
    ?type: M,
    ?username: string,
) => int where C: Equatable

source_location.source:
event = (
        url,
        username="",
        password="",
        apiKey="",
        action="EventsRouter",
        method="add_event",
        type="rpc",
        tid=1,
        summary="",
        device="",
        component="",
        severity,
        eventClass="",
        eventClassKey="",
        collector="",
        message="",
    ) =>
    {
        event = {
            summary: summary,
            device: device,
            component: component,
            severity: severity,
            evclass: eventClass,
            evclasskey: eventClassKey,
            collector: collector,
            message: message,
        }
        payload = {
            action: action,
            method: method,
            data: [event],
            type: type,
            tid: tid,
        }
        headers = {"Content-Type": "application/json"}
        body = json.encode(v: payload)

        return
            if apiKey != "" then
                http.post(headers: {headers with "z-api-key": apiKey}, url: url, data: body)
            else
                http.post(
                    headers: {headers with "Authorization":
                            http.basicAuth(u: username, p: password),
                    },
                    url: url,
                    data: body,
                )
    }

name: influxdb
headline: Package influxdb provides additional functions for querying data from InfluxDB.

from.name: from
from.headline: from retrieves data from an InfluxDB bucket between the `start` and `stop` times.

parameters.name: bucket
parameters.headline: bucket: Name of the bucket to query.

parameters.name: start
parameters.headline: start: Earliest time to include in results.

parameters.name: stop
parameters.headline: stop: Latest time to include in results. Default is `now()`.

parameters.name: host
parameters.headline: host: URL of the InfluxDB instance to query.

parameters.name: org
parameters.headline: org: Organization name.

parameters.name: token
parameters.headline: token: InfluxDB [API token](https://docs.influxdata.com/influxdb/latest/security/tokens/).

from.flux_type:
(
    bucket: string,
    start: A,
    ?host: string,
    ?org: string,
    ?stop: B,
    ?token: string,
) => stream[{
    C with
    _value: D,
    _time: time,
    _stop: time,
    _start: time,
    _measurement: string,
    _field: string,
}]

source_location.source:
from = (
        bucket,
        start,
        stop=now(),
        org="",
        host="",
        token="",
    ) =>
    {
        source =
            if org != "" and host != "" and token != "" then
                influxdb.from(bucket, org, host, token)
            else if org != "" and token != "" then
                influxdb.from(bucket, org, token)
            else if org != "" and host != "" then
                influxdb.from(bucket, org, host)
            else if host != "" and token != "" then
                influxdb.from(bucket, host, token)
            else if org != "" then
                influxdb.from(bucket, org)
            else if host != "" then
                influxdb.from(bucket, host)
            else if token != "" then
                influxdb.from(bucket, token)
            else
                influxdb.from(bucket)

        return source |> range(start, stop)
    }

select.name: select
select.headline:
select is an alternate implementation of `from()`,
`range()`, `filter()` and `pivot()` that returns pivoted query results and masks
the `_measurement`, `_start`, and `_stop` columns. Results are similar to those
returned by InfluxQL `SELECT` statements.

parameters.name: from
parameters.headline: from: Name of the bucket to query.

parameters.name: start
parameters.headline: start: Earliest time to include in results.

parameters.name: stop
parameters.headline: stop: Latest time to include in results. Default is `now()`.

parameters.name: m
parameters.headline: m: Name of the measurement to query.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.headline: fields: List of fields to query. Default is`[]`.

parameters.name: where
parameters.headline:
where: Single argument predicate function that evaluates `true` or `false`
  and filters results based on tag values.
  Default is `(r) => true`.

parameters.name: host
parameters.headline: host: URL of the InfluxDB instance to query.

parameters.name: org
parameters.headline: org: Organization name.

parameters.name: token
parameters.headline: token: InfluxDB [API token](https://docs.influxdata.com/influxdb/latest/security/tokens/).

select.flux_type:
(
    from: string,
    m: A,
    start: B,
    ?fields: [string],
    ?host: string,
    ?org: string,
    ?stop: C,
    ?token: string,
    ?where: (
        r: {
            D with
            _value: E,
            _time: time,
            _stop: time,
            _start: time,
            _measurement: string,
            _field: string,
        },
    ) => bool,
) => stream[F] where A: Equatable, F: Record

source_location.source:
select = (
        from,
        start,
        stop=now(),
        m,
        fields=[],
        org="",
        host="",
        token="",
        where=(r) => true,
    ) =>
    {
        bucket = from
        tables =
            _from(
                bucket,
                start,
                stop,
                org,
                host,
                token,
            )
                |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == m)
                |> filter(fn: where)
        nfields = length(arr: fields)
        fn =
            if nfields == 0 then
                (r) => true
            else if nfields == 1 then
                (r) => r._field == fields[0]
            else if nfields == 2 then
                (r) => r._field == fields[0] or r._field == fields[1]
            else if nfields == 3 then
                (r) => r._field == fields[0] or r._field == fields[1] or r._field == fields[2]
            else if nfields == 4 then
                (r) =>
                    r._field == fields[0] or r._field == fields[1] or r._field == fields[2]
                        or
                        r._field == fields[3]
            else if nfields == 5 then
                (r) =>
                    r._field == fields[0] or r._field == fields[1] or r._field == fields[2]
                        or
                        r._field == fields[3] or r._field == fields[4]
            else
                (r) => contains(value: r._field, set: fields)

        return
            tables
                |> filter(fn)
                |> v1.fieldsAsCols()
                |> _mask(columns: ["_measurement", "_start", "_stop"])
    }

name: clickhouse
headline: Package clickhouse provides functions to query [ClickHouse](https://clickhouse.com/) using the ClickHouse HTTP API.

defaultURL.name: defaultURL
defaultURL.headline: defaultURL is the default ClickHouse HTTP API URL.

source_location.source: option defaultURL = "http://127.0.0.1:8123"

query.name: query
query.headline: query queries data from ClickHouse using specified parameters.

parameters.name: url
parameters.headline: url: ClickHouse HTTP API URL. Default is `http://127.0.0.1:8123`.

parameters.name: query
parameters.headline: query: ClickHouse query to execute.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.headline: limit: Query rows limit. Defaults is `100`.

parameters.name: cors
parameters.headline: cors: Request remote CORS headers. Defaults is `1`.

parameters.name: max_bytes
parameters.headline: max_bytes: Query bytes limit. Default is `10000000`.

parameters.name: format
parameters.headline: format: Query format. Default is `CSVWithNames`.

query.flux_type:
(
    query: string,
    ?cors: string,
    ?format: string,
    ?limit: A,
    ?max_bytes: B,
    ?url: string,
) => stream[C] where A: Stringable, B: Stringable, C: Record

source_location.source:
query = (
        url=defaultURL,
        query,
        limit=100,
        cors="1",
        max_bytes=10000000,
        format="CSVWithNames",
    ) =>
    {
        response =
            requests.get(
                url: url,
                params:
                    [
                        "query": [query],
                        "default_format": [format],
                        "max_result_rows": ["${limit}"],
                        "max_result_bytes": ["${max_bytes}"],
                        "add_http_cors_header": [cors],
                    ],
                headers: ["X-ClickHouse-Format": string(v: format)],
            )

        return csv.from(csv: string(v: response.body), mode: "raw")
    }

name: iox
headline: Package iox provides additional functions for querying data from InfluxDB IOx.

from.name: from
from.headline: from retrieves data from an IOx bucket between the `start` and `stop` times.

parameters.name: bucket
parameters.headline: bucket: Name of the IOx bucket to query.

parameters.name: start
parameters.headline: start: Earliest time to include in results.

parameters.name: stop
parameters.headline: stop: Latest time to include in results. Default is `now()`.

parameters.name: host
parameters.headline: host: URL of the IOx instance to query.

parameters.name: org
parameters.headline: org: Organization name.

parameters.name: token
parameters.headline: token: [API token](https://docs.influxdata.com/influxdb/latest/security/tokens/).

parameters.name: table
parameters.headline: table: Table used in the FlightSQL query.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.headline: limit: Limit for the FlightSQL query. Default is `1000`.

parameters.name: columns
parameters.headline: columns: Columns selected by the FlightSQL query. Default is `*`.

parameters.name: secure
parameters.headline: secure: Secure connection to IOx instance. Default is `true`.

from.flux_type:
(
    bucket: A,
    ?columns: B,
    ?host: C,
    ?limit: D,
    ?org: E,
    ?secure: F,
    ?start: G,
    ?stop: H,
    ?table: I,
    ?token: J,
) => stream[K] where A: Stringable, B: Stringable, C: Equatable + Stringable, D: Stringable, E: Equatable + Stringable, F: Stringable, G: Timeable, H: Timeable, I: Stringable, J: Equatable + Stringable, K: Record

source_location.source:
from =
    (
            bucket,
            start=-1h,
            stop=now(),
            org="",
            host="",
            token="",
            table="",
            columns="*",
            limit="1000",
            secure="true",
        ) =>
        {

            dataSourceName =
                if org != "" and host != "" and token != "" then
                    "iox://${host}/${bucket}?secure=${secure}&token=${token}"
                else if org != "" and token != "" then
                    "iox://${host}/${org}_${bucket}?secure=${secure}&token=${token}"
                else if org != "" and host != "" then
                    "iox://${host}/${org}_${bucket}?secure=${secure}"
                else if host != "" and token != "" then
                    "iox://${host}/${bucket}?secure=${secure}&token=${token}"
                else if org != "" then
                    "iox://${host}/${org}_${bucket}?secure=${secure}"
                else if host != "" then
                    "iox://${host}/${bucket}?secure=${secure}&token=${token}"
                else
                    "iox://${host}/${bucket}?secure=${secure}"

            qStart = date.time(t: start)
            qStop = date.time(t: stop)
            query =
                "SELECT ${columns} FROM ${table} WHERE ( time >= '${qStart}' AND  time <= '${qStop}') LIMIT ${limit}"

            source =
                sql.from(
                    driverName: "influxdb-iox",
                    dataSourceName: "${dataSourceName}",
                    query: "${query}",
                )

            return source |> rename(columns: {time: "_time"})
        }

name: logql
headline: Package logql provides functions for using [LogQL](https://grafana.com/docs/loki/latest/logql/) to query a [Loki](https://grafana.com/oss/loki/) data source.

defaultAPI.name: defaultAPI
defaultAPI.headline: defaultAPI is the default LogQL Query Range API Path.

source_location.source: option defaultAPI = "/loki/api/v1/query_range"

defaultURL.name: defaultURL
defaultURL.headline: defaultURL is the default LogQL HTTP API URL.

source_location.source: option defaultURL = "http://127.0.0.1:3100"

query_range.name: query_range
query_range.headline:
query_range queries data from a specified LogQL query within given time bounds,
filters data by query, timerange, and optional limit expressions.
All values are returned as string values (using `raw` mode in `csv.from`)

parameters.name: url
parameters.headline: url: LogQL/qryn URL and port. Default is `http://qryn:3100`.

parameters.name: path
parameters.headline: path: LogQL query_range API path.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.headline: limit: Query limit. Default is 100.

parameters.name: query
parameters.headline: query: LogQL query to execute.

parameters.name: start
parameters.headline: start: Earliest time to include in results. Default is `-1h`.

parameters.name: end
parameters.headline: end: Latest time to include in results. Default is `now()`.

parameters.name: step
parameters.headline: step: Query resolution step width in seconds. Default is 10.

parameters.name: orgid
parameters.headline: orgid: Optional Loki organization ID for partitioning. Default is `""`.

query_range.flux_type:
(
    query: string,
    ?end: A,
    ?limit: B,
    ?orgid: string,
    ?path: string,
    ?start: C,
    ?step: D,
    ?url: string,
) => stream[E] where A: Timeable, B: Stringable, C: Timeable, D: Stringable, E: Record

source_location.source:
query_range = (
        url=defaultURL,
        path=defaultAPI,
        query,
        limit=100,
        step=10,
        start=-1h,
        end=now(),
        orgid="",
    ) =>
    {
        dstart = date.time(t: start)
        dend = date.time(t: end)
        response =
            requests.get(
                url: url + path,
                params:
                    [
                        "query": [query],
                        "limit": ["${limit}"],
                        "start": [string(v: uint(v: dstart))],
                        "end": [string(v: uint(v: dend))],
                        "step": ["${step}"],
                        "csv": ["1"],
                    ],
                headers: if orgid != "" then ["X-Scope-OrgID": orgid] else [:],
                body: bytes(v: query),
            )

        return csv.from(csv: string(v: response.body), mode: "raw")
    }

name: bigpanda
headline: Package bigpanda provides functions for sending alerts to [BigPanda](https://www.bigpanda.io/).

defaultTokenPrefix.name: defaultTokenPrefix
defaultTokenPrefix.headline:
defaultTokenPrefix is the default HTTP authentication scheme to use when authenticating with BigPanda.
Default is `Bearer`.

source_location.source: option defaultTokenPrefix = "Bearer"

defaultUrl.name: defaultUrl
defaultUrl.headline:
defaultUrl is the default [BigPanda alerts API URL](https://docs.bigpanda.io/reference#alerts-how-it-works)
for functions in the `bigpanda` package.
Default is `https://api.bigpanda.io/data/v2/alerts`.

source_location.source: option defaultUrl = "https://api.bigpanda.io/data/v2/alerts"

endpoint.name: endpoint
endpoint.headline: endpoint sends alerts to BigPanda using data from input rows.

parameters.name: url
parameters.headline:
url: BigPanda [alerts API URL](https://docs.bigpanda.io/reference#alerts-how-it-works).
  Default is the value of the `bigpanda.defaultURL` option.

parameters.name: token
parameters.headline: token: BigPanda [API Authorization token (API key)](https://docs.bigpanda.io/docs/api-key-management).

parameters.name: appKey
parameters.headline: appKey: BigPanda [App Key](https://docs.bigpanda.io/reference#integrating-monitoring-systems).

endpoint.flux_type:
(
    appKey: A,
    token: string,
    ?url: string,
) => (mapFn: (r: B) => {C with status: D}) => (<-tables: stream[B]) => stream[{B with _sent: string}]

source_location.source:
endpoint = (url=defaultUrl, token, appKey) =>
    (mapFn) =>
        (tables=<-) =>
            tables
                |> map(
                    fn: (r) => {
                        obj = mapFn(r: r)

                        return {r with _sent:
                                string(
                                    v:
                                        2 == sendAlert(
                                                url: url,
                                                appKey: appKey,
                                                token: token,
                                                status: obj.status,
                                                rec: obj,
                                            ) / 100,
                                ),
                        }
                    },
                )

sendAlert.name: sendAlert
sendAlert.headline: sendAlert sends an alert to [BigPanda](https://www.bigpanda.io/).

parameters.name: url
parameters.headline:
url: BigPanda [alerts API URL](https://docs.bigpanda.io/reference#alerts-how-it-works).
  Default is the value of the `bigpanda.defaultURL` option.

parameters.name: token
parameters.headline: token: BigPanda [API Authorization token (API key)](https://docs.bigpanda.io/docs/api-key-management).

parameters.name: appKey
parameters.headline: appKey: BigPanda [App Key](https://docs.bigpanda.io/reference#integrating-monitoring-systems).

parameters.name: status
parameters.headline: status: BigPanda [alert status](https://docs.bigpanda.io/reference#alerts).

parameters.name: rec
parameters.headline: rec: Additional [alert parameters](https://docs.bigpanda.io/reference#alert-object) to send to the BigPanda alert API.

sendAlert.flux_type:
(
    appKey: A,
    rec: B,
    status: C,
    token: string,
    url: string,
) => int

statusFromLevel.name: statusFromLevel
statusFromLevel.headline: statusFromLevel converts an alert level to a BigPanda status.

parameters.name: level
parameters.headline: level: Alert level.

source_location.source:
statusFromLevel = (level) => {
    lvl = strings.toLower(v: level)
    sev =
        if lvl == "warn" then
            "warning"
        else if lvl == "crit" then
            "critical"
        else if lvl == "info" then
            "ok"
        else if lvl == "ok" then
            "ok"
        else
            "critical"

    return sev
}

name: opsgenie
headline:
Package opsgenie provides functions that send alerts to
[Atlassian Opsgenie](https://www.atlassian.com/software/opsgenie)
using the [Opsgenie v2 API](https://docs.opsgenie.com/docs/alert-api#create-alert).

endpoint.name: endpoint
endpoint.headline: endpoint sends an alert message to Opsgenie using data from table rows.

parameters.name: url
parameters.headline: url: Opsgenie API URL. Defaults to `https://api.opsgenie.com/v2/alerts`.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.headline: apiKey: (Required) Opsgenie API authorization key.

parameters.name: entity
parameters.headline: entity: Alert entity used to specify the alert domain.

endpoint.flux_type:
(
    apiKey: string,
    ?entity: string,
    ?url: string,
) => (
    mapFn: (
        r: A,
    ) => {
        B with
        visibleTo: [string],
        tags: E,
        responders: [string],
        priority: string,
        message: string,
        details: D,
        description: string,
        alias: string,
        actions: C,
    },
) => (<-tables: stream[A]) => stream[{A with _sent: string}] where D: Stringable

source_location.source:
endpoint = (url="https://api.opsgenie.com/v2/alerts", apiKey, entity="") =>
    (mapFn) =>
        (tables=<-) =>
            tables
                |> map(
                    fn: (r) => {
                        obj = mapFn(r: r)

                        return {r with _sent:
                                string(
                                    v:
                                        2 == sendAlert(
                                                url: url,
                                                apiKey: apiKey,
                                                entity: entity,
                                                message: obj.message,
                                                alias: obj.alias,
                                                description: obj.description,
                                                priority: obj.priority,
                                                responders: obj.responders,
                                                tags: obj.tags,
                                                actions: obj.actions,
                                                visibleTo: obj.visibleTo,
                                                details: obj.details,
                                            ) / 100,
                                ),
                        }
                    },
                )

respondersToJSON.name: respondersToJSON
respondersToJSON.headline:
respondersToJSON converts an array of Opsgenie responder strings
to a string-encoded JSON array that can be embedded in an alert message.

parameters.name: v
parameters.headline:
v: (Required) Array of Opsgenie responder strings.
  Responder strings must begin with
  `user: `, `team: `, `escalation: `, or `schedule: `.

source_location.source: builtin respondersToJSON : (v: [string]) => string

sendAlert.name: sendAlert
sendAlert.headline: sendAlert sends an alert message to Opsgenie.

parameters.name: url
parameters.headline: url: Opsgenie API URL. Defaults to `https://api.opsgenie.com/v2/alerts`.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.headline: apiKey: (Required) Opsgenie API authorization key.

parameters.name: message
parameters.headline:
message: (Required) Alert message text.
  130 characters or less.

parameters.name: alias
parameters.headline:
alias: Opsgenie alias usee to de-deduplicate alerts.
  250 characters or less.
  Defaults to [message](https://docs.influxdata.com/flux/v0.x/stdlib/contrib/sranka/opsgenie/sendalert/#message).

parameters.name: description
parameters.headline: description: Alert description. 15000 characters or less.

parameters.name: priority
parameters.headline: priority: Opsgenie alert priority.

parameters.name: responders
parameters.headline:
responders: List of responder teams or users.
  Use the `user: ` prefix for users and `teams: ` prefix for teams.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.headline: tags: Alert tags.

parameters.name: entity
parameters.headline: entity: Alert entity used to specify the alert domain.

parameters.name: actions
parameters.headline: actions: List of actions available for the alert.

parameters.name: details
parameters.headline: details: Additional alert details. Must be a JSON-encoded map of key-value string pairs.

parameters.name: visibleTo
parameters.headline:
visibleTo: List of teams and users the alert will be visible to without sending notifications.
  Use the `user: ` prefix for users and `teams: ` prefix for teams.

sendAlert.flux_type:
(
    apiKey: string,
    message: string,
    ?actions: A,
    ?alias: string,
    ?description: string,
    ?details: B,
    ?entity: string,
    ?priority: string,
    ?responders: [string],
    ?tags: C,
    ?url: string,
    ?visibleTo: [string],
) => int where B: Stringable

source_location.source:
sendAlert = (
        url="https://api.opsgenie.com/v2/alerts",
        apiKey,
        message,
        alias="",
        description="",
        priority="P3",
        responders=[],
        tags=[],
        entity="",
        actions=[],
        visibleTo=[],
        details="{}",
    ) =>
    {
        headers = {
            "Content-Type": "application/json; charset=utf-8",
            "Authorization": "GenieKey " + apiKey,
        }
        cutEncode = (v, max, defV="") => {
            v2 = if strings.strlen(v: v) != 0 then v else defV

            return
                if strings.strlen(v: v2) > max then
                    string(v: json.encode(v: "${strings.substring(v: v2, start: 0, end: max)}"))
                else
                    string(v: json.encode(v: v2))
        }
        body = "{
\"message\": ${cutEncode(v: message, max: 130)},
\"alias\": ${cutEncode(v: alias, max: 512, defV: message)},
\"description\": ${cutEncode(v: description, max: 15000)},
\"responders\": ${respondersToJSON(v: responders)},
\"visibleTo\": ${respondersToJSON(v: visibleTo)},
\"actions\": ${string(v: json.encode(v: actions))},
\"tags\": ${string(v: json.encode(v: tags))},
\"details\": ${details},
\"entity\": ${cutEncode(v: entity, max: 512)},
\"priority\": ${cutEncode(v: priority, max: 2)}
}"

        return http.post(headers: headers, url: url, data: bytes(v: body))
    }

name: sensu
headline: Package sensu provides functions for sending events to [Sensu Go](https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/).

endpoint.name: endpoint
endpoint.headline:
endpoint sends an event
to the [Sensu Events API](https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/api/events/#create-a-new-event)
using data from table rows.

parameters.name: url
parameters.headline:
url: Base URL of [Sensu API](https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/migrate/#architecture)
  *without a trailing slash*.
  Example: `http://localhost:8080`.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.headline: apiKey: Sensu [API Key](https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/operations/control-access/).

parameters.name: handlers
parameters.headline:
handlers: [Sensu handlers](https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/reference/handlers/) to execute.
  Default is `[]`.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.headline:
namespace: [Sensu namespace](https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/reference/rbac/).
  Default is `default`.

parameters.name: entityName
parameters.headline:
entityName: Event source.
  Default is `influxdb`.

endpoint.flux_type:
(
    apiKey: string,
    url: string,
    ?entityName: string,
    ?handlers: A,
    ?namespace: string,
) => (
    mapFn: (r: B) => {C with text: E, status: D, checkName: string},
) => (<-tables: stream[B]) => stream[{B with _sent: string}] where D: Equatable

source_location.source:
endpoint = (
    url,
    apiKey,
    handlers=[],
    namespace="default",
    entityName="influxdb",
) =>
    (mapFn) =>
        (tables=<-) =>
            tables
                |> map(
                    fn: (r) => {
                        obj = mapFn(r: r)

                        return {r with _sent:
                                string(
                                    v:
                                        2 == event(
                                                url: url,
                                                apiKey: apiKey,
                                                checkName: obj.checkName,
                                                text: obj.text,
                                                handlers: handlers,
                                                status: obj.status,
                                                namespace: namespace,
                                                entityName: entityName,
                                            ) / 100,
                                ),
                        }
                    },
                )

event.name: event
event.headline: event sends a single event to the [Sensu Events API](https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/api/events/#create-a-new-event).

parameters.name: url
parameters.headline:
url: Base URL of [Sensu API](https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/migrate/#architecture)
  without a trailing slash.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.headline: apiKey: Sensu [API Key](https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/operations/control-access/).

parameters.name: checkName
parameters.headline: checkName: Check name.

parameters.name: text
parameters.headline: text: Event text.

parameters.name: handlers
parameters.headline: handlers: Sensu handlers to execute. Default is `[]`.

parameters.name: status
parameters.headline:
status: Event status code that indicates [state](https://docs.influxdata.com/flux/v0.x/stdlib/contrib/sranka/sensu/event/#state).
  Default is `0`.

parameters.name: state
parameters.headline:
state: Event state.
  Default is `"passing"` for `0` [status](https://docs.influxdata.com/flux/v0.x/stdlib/contrib/sranka/sensu/event/#status) and `"failing"` for other statuses.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.headline:
namespace: [Sensu namespace](https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/reference/rbac/).
  Default is `"default"`.

parameters.name: entityName
parameters.headline:
entityName: Event source.
  Default is `influxdb`.

event.flux_type:
(
    apiKey: string,
    checkName: string,
    text: A,
    url: string,
    ?entityName: string,
    ?handlers: B,
    ?namespace: string,
    ?state: string,
    ?status: C,
) => int where C: Equatable

endpoint = (url) =>
    (mapFn) =>
        (tables=<-) =>

                    fn: (r) => {

                        return {r with _sent:

endpoint = (
    url=defaultURL,
    token,
    parseMode=defaultParseMode,
    disableWebPagePreview=defaultDisableWebPagePreview,

                |> map(
                    fn: (r) => {

                                                text: obj.text,

name: boundaries
headline: Package boundaries provides operators for finding the boundaries around certain days, months, and weeks.

friday.name: friday
friday.headline: friday returns a record with `start` and `stop` boundary timestamps for last Friday.

monday.name: monday
monday.headline:
monday returns a record with `start` and `stop` boundary timestamps of last Monday.
Last Monday is relative to `now()`. If today is Monday, the function returns boundaries for the previous Monday.

month.name: month
month.headline: month returns a record with `start` and `stop` boundary timestamps for the current month.

parameters.name: month_offset
parameters.headline: month_offset: Number of months to offset from the current month. Default is `0`.

saturday.name: saturday
saturday.headline: saturday returns a record with `start` and `stop` boundary timestamps for last Saturday.

sunday.name: sunday
sunday.headline: sunday returns a record with `start` and `stop` boundary timestamps for last Sunday.

thursday.name: thursday
thursday.headline: thursday returns a record with `start` and `stop` boundary timestamps for last Thursday.

tuesday.name: tuesday
tuesday.headline: tuesday returns a record with `start` and `stop` boundary timestamps of last Tuesday.

wednesday.name: wednesday
wednesday.headline: wednesday returns a record with `start` and `stop` boundary timestamps for last Wednesday.

week.name: week
week.headline:
week returns a record with `start` and `stop` boundary timestamps of the current week.
By default, weeks start on Monday.

parameters.name: start_sunday
parameters.headline: start_sunday: Indicate if the week starts on Sunday. Default is `false`.

parameters.name: week_offset
parameters.headline: week_offset: Number of weeks to offset from the current week. Default is `0`.

yesterday.name: yesterday
yesterday.headline: yesterday returns a record with `start` and `stop` boundary timestamps for yesterday.

alignTime.name: alignTime
alignTime.headline: alignTime shifts time values in input tables to all start at a common start time.

parameters.name: alignTo
parameters.headline: alignTo: Time to align tables to. Default is `1970-01-01T00:00:00Z`.

parameters.name: tables
parameters.headline: tables: Input data. Default is piped-forward data (`<-`).

source_location.source:
alignTime = (tables=<-, alignTo=time(v: 0)) =>
    tables
        |> stateDuration(fn: (r) => true, column: "timeDiff", unit: 1ns)
        |> map(fn: (r) => ({r with _time: time(v: int(v: alignTo) + r.timeDiff)}))
        |> drop(columns: ["timeDiff"])

    ?period: duration,

window = (
    tables=<-,
    every=0s,
    period=0s,
    offset=0s,

        |> _window(

name: aggregate
headline: Package aggregate provides functions to simplify common aggregate operations.

rate.name: rate
rate.headline:
rate calculates the average rate of increase per window of time for each
input table.

parameters.name: every
parameters.headline: every: Duration of time windows.

parameters.name: groupColumns
parameters.headline: groupColumns: List of columns to group by. Default is `[]`.

parameters.name: unit
parameters.headline: unit: Time duration to use when calculating the rate. Default is `1s`.

parameters.name: tables
parameters.headline: tables: Input data. Default is piped-forward data (`<-`).

rate.flux_type: (<-tables: stream[A], every: duration, ?groupColumns: [string], ?unit: duration) => stream[B] where A: Record, B: Record

source_location.source:
rate = (tables=<-, every, groupColumns=[], unit=1s) =>
    tables
        |> derivative(nonNegative: true, unit: unit)
        |> aggregateWindow(
            every: every,
            fn: (tables=<-, column) =>
                tables
                    |> mean(column: column)
                    |> group(columns: groupColumns)
                    |> experimental.group(columns: ["_start", "_stop"], mode: "extend")
                    |> sum(),
        )

name: boundaries
headline: Package boundaries provides operators for finding the boundaries around certain days, months, and weeks.

friday.name: friday
friday.headline: friday returns a record with `start` and `stop` boundary timestamps for last Friday.

monday.name: monday
monday.headline:
monday returns a record with `start` and `stop` boundary timestamps of last Monday.
Last Monday is relative to `now()`. If today is Monday, the function returns boundaries for the previous Monday.

month.name: month
month.headline: month returns a record with `start` and `stop` boundary timestamps for the current month.

parameters.name: month_offset
parameters.headline: month_offset: Number of months to offset from the current month. Default is `0`.

saturday.name: saturday
saturday.headline: saturday returns a record with `start` and `stop` boundary timestamps for last Saturday.

sunday.name: sunday
sunday.headline: sunday returns a record with `start` and `stop` boundary timestamps for last Sunday.

thursday.name: thursday
thursday.headline: thursday returns a record with `start` and `stop` boundary timestamps for last Thursday.

tuesday.name: tuesday
tuesday.headline: tuesday returns a record with `start` and `stop` boundary timestamps of last Tuesday.

wednesday.name: wednesday
wednesday.headline: wednesday returns a record with `start` and `stop` boundary timestamps for last Wednesday.

week.name: week
week.headline:
week returns a record with `start` and `stop` boundary timestamps of the current week.
By default, weeks start on Monday.

parameters.name: start_sunday
parameters.headline: start_sunday: Indicate if the week starts on Sunday. Default is `false`.

parameters.name: week_offset
parameters.headline: week_offset: Number of weeks to offset from the current week. Default is `0`.

yesterday.name: yesterday
yesterday.headline: yesterday returns a record with `start` and `stop` boundary timestamps for yesterday.
